channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Heading to the Mideast, Pope Leo May Show ‘Who He Really Is’
item.description: The pontiff begins a trip to Turkey and Lebanon on Thursday — the first foreign voyage of his papacy, and his biggest test yet.

item.title: What to Know About the Deadly Fire at a Hong Kong Apartment Complex
item.description: Firefighters were still working to end the blaze nearly a day later. At least 44 people were killed, and many more were feared trapped inside the towe...

item.title: Hong Kong Arrests 3 Tied to Construction Company After Deadly Apartment Fire
item.description: The police said that building materials used by the company for the work at Wang Fuk Court may not have been up to fire safety standards. The police d...

item.title: Campbell’s Says Executive Accused of Offensive Remarks Has Left the Company
item.description: The comments came to light after an audiotape was released, tied to a lawsuit filed by a former employee.

item.title: Hong Kong Arrests 3 Tied to Construction Company After Deadly Apartment Fire
item.description: The police said that building materials used by the company for the work at Wang Fuk Court may not have been up to fire safety standards. The police d...

item.title: U.K. Budget Plan Calms Markets and Labour Faithful. Will It Appeal to Voters?
item.description: The plan presented by the chancellor of the Exchequer, Rachel Reeves, called for spending increases and higher taxes on the wealthy and the middle cla...

item.title: Live Updates: Hong Kong Towers Still Smolder From Fire That Has Killed At Least 44
item.description: Dark smoke was rising nearly 24 hours after the blaze engulfed the apartment complex. More than 270 people were still missing.

item.title: An Asia-Pacific Showdown
item.description: China and Japan are in a diplomatic feud over Taiwan, with President Trump in the middle.

item.title: The Real Meaning of MAHA Is ‘You’re On Your Own’
item.description: The N.I.H. director has learned all the wrong lessons from Covid.

item.title: Heading to the Mideast, Pope Leo May Show ‘Who He Really Is’
item.description: The pontiff begins a trip to Turkey and Lebanon on Thursday — the first foreign voyage of his papacy, and his biggest test yet.

item.title: Supreme Court to hear Texas landlord’s lawsuit against the Post Office for failing to deliver mail for 2 years
item.description: The DOJ argued that if the landlord wins, people will infer mail didn’t arrive “because of a rude comment that they heard, or what have you.”

item.title: Americans can’t agree on what ‘middle class’ means anymore, and they’re debating it in the comments of TikTok home tours
item.description: The “average” or “normal” home tour is fascinating, even dividing, thousands of Americans on TikTok who can’t agree on social class.

item.title: ‘Low-hire, low-fire’ economy grinds on as lower-than-expected jobless claims suggests layoffs aren’t spiking
item.description: U.S. applications for unemployment benefits in the week ending Nov. 22 dropped 6,000 from the previous week to 216,000, the Labor Department reported.

item.title: Campbell’s fires exec after leaked recording berating ‘poor’ customers and ‘bioengineered meat’ prompts outrage and investigation
item.description: The comments were caught on a recording by a now-former employee.

item.title: Why an ASEAN power grid is key to tapping Southeast Asia’s green potential
item.description: A regional grid may be pricy, but it can help export green power where it needs to go—and boost regional cooperation too.
